# removeValue(forProperty:)

**Instance Method**

Removes the value for a given property.

## Declaration

```swift
func removeValue(forProperty property: String!) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **property**: The property whose value will be removed.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the value is removed successfully; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

When you next call [doc://com.apple.addressbook/documentation/AddressBook/ABRecord-swift.class/value(forProperty:)] on that property, it returns `nil`.

If property is `nil`, this method raises an exception.

For a list of the available properties, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/AddressBook/Tasks/AccessingData.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20001023] in [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/AddressBook/AddressBook.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000117i].

## Retrieving and Setting Values

- **setValue(_:forProperty:)**: Sets the value of a given property for a record.
- **setValue(_:forProperty:error:)**: Sets the value of a given property for a record, returning error information.
- **value(forProperty:)**: Returns the value of a given property for a record.
